title: Songs III
first_line: when life is quite through with
text:
when life is quite through with
and leaves say alas,
much is to do
for the swallow,that closes
a flight in the blue;

when love ’s had his tears out,
perhaps shall pass
a million years
(while a bee dozes
on the poppies,the dears;

when all’s done and said,and
under the grass
lies her head
by oaks and roses
deliberated.)
description: when life is quite through with
seo_title: when life is quite through with
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “XLI Poems”
